text: Canine parvovirus ( CPV ) is a member of autonomous parvoviruses in the Parvoviridae family . It appears as an icosahedral capsid that encloses a single - strand DNA genome that is 5 . 2 kb long . CPV replicates without the use of a helper virus and hence is called autonomous , but it utilises the machinery and components of host cells , including DNA polymerase and RNA polymerase Ι Ι for DNA replication and RNA transcription , respectively . Consequently , CPV replication is restricted to the S phase of the cell cycle 1 , 2 .
